articles.title: The Gap
articles.description: A thorough, detailed exploration of the various pain points that the widely supported CSS 'gap' property solves. Lots of code examples and demos here to help you get a solid understanding of things.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: An Intro to CSS Anchor Positioning with Basic Examples
articles.description: This is a solid overview of the CSS Anchoring API (already available in Chrome 125, others to follow), highlighting some of its shortcomings, the wins it introduces for creating complex layouts, and more.
articles.author: Brecht De Ruyte

articles.title: CSS Length Units
articles.description: A comprehensive guide covering nine types of lengths that CSS uses to size elements in terms of dimensions, space, time, and even sound. The sort of thing worth bookmarking.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Transition to height: auto; and display: none; Using Pure CSS
articles.description: How to easily transition from height: 0; to height: auto; and display: none; to display: block; without any hacks, tricks, or JS, using only new CSS features such as the calc-size() function, transition-behavior property and @starting-style at-rule.
articles.author: Zoran Jambor

articles.title: In Praise of the Basics
articles.description: When starting out, is learning the ‚Äòbasics‚Äô of frontend development still the best way to go? Particularly with a seemingly endless supply of frameworks? Geoff puts forward the case for starting with straightforward HTML & CSS, and even explains why going back to these key basics can enhance your career.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: How Deep is Your DOM?
articles.description: A look at how the depth of a DOM tree affects rendering performance. Plus, a question the Bee Gees might have had, if they had been web designers..
articles.author: Maxi Ferreira

articles.title: ‚ÄúJust‚Äù One Line
articles.description: Adding just one line of code, be that for styles, scripts, frameworks, etc is something of a facade. Jim challenges us to pause and consider the long-term implications.
articles.author: Jim Nielsen

articles.title: Screen Ruler: A Chrome Extension to Measure and Analyze Page Elements
articles.description: Once enabled, it lets you hover over elements to view info similar to DevTools (padding, margin, etc.) with the added ability to measure specific distances on the page.
articles.author: Myster Violets

articles.title: Type Fluidity: A Tool to Calculate Fluid Typography Sizes
articles.description: Select px or rem units and define font and viewport sizes to generate the custom CSS clamp function. You can also preview the result with a custom line height and your choice of Google font.
articles.author: required

articles.title: SVG Gobbler: Find, Optimize, Edit, and Manage SVG
articles.description: An open-source browser extension that finds the SVG content in your current tab and lets you optimize, download, copy, edit, or export. Something that really should be built into browsers nowadays!
articles.author: Ross Moody

articles.title: A-Frame 1.6: A Framework for Building WebVR Experiences
articles.description: A web framework for building virtual reality experiences that work on Vive, Rift, Quest, as well as desktop and mobile platforms, including in the browser (as the demos here show).
articles.author: A-Frame VR Team

articles.title: Chromicons: A Set of 400+ Handcrafted SVG Icons
articles.description: Not a new project, but a nice set of searchable line icons, easy to copy and paste as SVG or download them all with one click.
articles.author: lifeomic

articles.title: FastBootstrap: A Bootstrap Theme Built with Atlassian Design
articles.description: Includes CSS utilities and a library of components with support for dark mode.
articles.author: FastBootstrap
